content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												With the addition of eGO servers, and a substantial fan-base, you can count on this being a pretty good-going game. Not to mention the teamwork and historically 'acurate' scenery and base-line. I say 'accurate' as with myself being an axis-history buff, there's slight discrepancies with uniform and setting e.t.c, however that's just me.If you like counter-strike (AKA Camperstrike) then this will suit you, especially when you can pick it up for £3 or so on a steam-sale. It's a tad more advanced than Counter-strike, with recoil and native commands e.t.c (German commands in German), you can definitely immerse yourself in WW2, in a more friendlier and consistently changing battlefield.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
												Ahhh. DoDS.I have been playing the DoD series since the first version on the GoldSrc engine. (My hours say like 35 or something but its really like 500+ between the two games).No you do not have perks.No their is no kill streak rewards, --sorry.No their is no weapon/player customization.However, what you have is an absolutely perfect WW2 shooter in a world of stagnant, ugly and recycled ideas in a frozen, dead genre.What you have here are mechanics that are unrivaled. In a nutshell, the mechanics are exactly the same as CS, considering it's the same engine, meaning that most of the mechanics are the same. CS is one of the most mentally demanding games on the market as of right now, and DODS isn't any different. The difference is the fun factor. Unlike CS, you can respawn every new wave of reinforcments (1-10 secs usually), and you can sit back and snipe, you can bum-rush people with automatic weapons, or you can screw around with nades/bazookas and just blow people up. GAMEPLAY wise this game has everything. Their might not be all the perks the new games have nowadays, but all that crap is just a leveling system to keep players locked in on their non-engaging game-- isn't it?All in all, this is probably the best WW2 shooter of all time, great maps, great weapons/mechanics, good community who strive for teamwork, etc. Graphics are a LITTLE bit dated, but imo this game still looks beautiful, the HDR looks great, and on full AA at high res, this game looks fantastic honestly.I say give this game a go, this may sound crazy to some, but I give it a 10/10Enjoy this classic and keep the community alive :)

content:
Posted: January 20
												When I first tried this, I really didn't like it. I died over and over and didn't see much to it. However, I had just finished playing Counter Strike, a much faster game, so I thought I might have been playing it wrong.Well, I was right. This game doesn't expect you to go out and blast people like a madman. It's very strategic, expecting you to plan your movements, hide behind cover and use shortcuts and alternate paths to flank your enemies. Not too interesting yet, right? But heres what the games biggest strength is: the team play. Each class has its role, whether it's taking out snipers and machine gunners or dealing massive close range damage. You're supposed to work together in your mission,which is either planting bombs or capturing points.Combine this with a lovely WWII theme, simple but unobtrusive and pretty environments and the coolest main menu music I've heard in a game and this is a great multilayer shooter, almost feeling like a cross between Team Fortress and Counter Strike.Also this remains the only Valve game so far feature iron sights. It's quite special.

												The Main gamemode is like a mix of control point and territorial control from TF2 and to top it all of all of the guns have recoil like in CSGO(however you can run and shoot pretty easily and theres no weapon spread)Since you die quickly and machinegun nest are hard to take down you be fighting over one point for AlONG timeand theres other times where the enemy team completely blitzkrieg the game and wins in like 1 minute(the 1st scenario is more common)The two sides each have different weapons it could just be me but all of the german weapons (besides the assault primary) are way better than the allied counter partLike in TF2, theres no all-round best class each class/gun has their advantages and drawbacks so your team has to be well balanced to winPROS:+ well designed but hard to use weapons+very well lit maps. content:
Posted: January 20
												When I first tried this, I really didn't like it. I died over and over and didn't see much to it. However, I had just finished playing Counter Strike, a much faster game, so I thought I might have been playing it wrong.Well, I was right. This game doesn't expect you to go out and blast people like a madman. It's very strategic, expecting you to plan your movements, hide behind cover and use shortcuts and alternate paths to flank your enemies. Not too interesting yet, right? But heres what the games biggest strength is: the team play. Each class has its role, whether it's taking out snipers and machine gunners or dealing massive close range damage. You're supposed to work together in your mission,which is either planting bombs or capturing points.Combine this with a lovely WWII theme, simple but unobtrusive and pretty environments and the coolest main menu music I've heard in a game and this is a great multilayer shooter, almost feeling like a cross between Team Fortress and Counter Strike.Also this remains the only Valve game so far feature iron sights. It's quite special.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2016
												I honestly think that DOD:S was a letdown. I played the original game, and it seems to play much better than this one. So many things were dropped when they remade this game, going to six classes instead of the numerous other ones. I've played this game quite a lot, and the now it seems that all of the weapons do jack sh!t. In the original DOD, when you shot someone, it hit. Seems now that you can't hit anything. How did they mess up with this? You can fire at someone with a rifle, with your sights right on them, and miss every single time. The weapons are incredibly inaccurate and really only work if you have time to line up your shot, (which normally isn't the case) or are point blank in their face, which, sometimes doesn't even work. Original DOD? You get in someone's face and shoot them, they get hit. The weapons had more weight to them and actually seemed to do something, where as the source version feel like BB guns.This seems like a bootlegged version, which is so close to being the thing they're trying to rip off, but fails miserably at some of the really important things. I don't necessarily love or hate this game, but I wouldn't recommend it.

												Great mutliplayer only game. Source engine ensures good audio-visuals. Standard maps are great and so are the modes: blow up crucial targets or dominate all the flags. Players can choose from 6 classes - only weapons and equipement are different. Obviously Allies and Axis look like they should, so all fine here. Rules are simple, but gameplay is solid and very enjoyable. Community created many custom maps and mods of various types.World War II multiplayer shooter with no unnecessary features.Too bad Valve forgot about DODS (I just wish they added solid bots like the one in CSS, CSGO and TF2, but what can't be done by devs, can be done by modders :D).

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6
OverviewDODS or Day of Defeat: Source is a Source Engine game made by Valve. It is a Class-Based FPS MMO World War II Simulator featuring the U.S. VS Wehrmacht.Pros-Looks nice for the time it was created.-Gameplay is smooth and fun.-Can't capture points unless there are two people on it.-Only a select few classes so that everybody has a role to play. Assault,Support,Sniper,Rifle-Man,Launcher-Man.-Only with certain guns you can aim down the sights. I like this, it proves challenging and teaches you to handle recoil.-Killing people is realistic, It doesn't take to long nor is it too easy to kill someone. -Shovel-I HAVE SOOOOO MUCH FPS MUHAHAHHAHAHHAHAHAH-You can break a wardrobe with your bare fist.-Realistic aiming sights.Cons-Sadly, it gets boring after a while. Maybe skins and customization would give this game some life.-There are die hard real world veterans and veteran supporters in this game. Don't♥♥♥♥♥♥them off.-The community is pretty bad.-Can't play offline with bots without a mod.-Needs more game-modes.ConclusionIt's pretty fun, if want to add some spice to the game, just go to gamebanana and download some mods. I would recommend this realistic team based FPS.Day of Defeat: Source Review written by Todosur. (2/6/2017)"Nothing is forgivable."

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Just buy DoD Original, Not source. This game isn't horrid it just isn't the same. If you've never played either it might be a better idea to research the differences between the two. Don't worry that you'll be losing players by going to the older one, both offer just as few populated servers. I've played a lot of DoD in my day, since the first days of the mod WAY before it was overhauled into what is known as 'original dod' / Day of Defeat on the steam store. Before the overhaul the game was basically a WW2 Team Death Match with 3 points per map. Maps were very crude. Suddenly the mod was overhauled and Valve suddenly became interested after millions of people downloaded it in only a few months, essentially it was the next counter-strike in the day and fell into the hands of valve, back then that wasn't bad.Even though it say's I have 2 hours of DoD source, I've played since launch. Out of the big source port overs (CS:Source, DoD:Source, TF2) this is definetly the crappier one in contrast to it's original. They simply nerfed it and tried to simplify it, I believe they were trying to stream line it back in the day, but honestly TF2 has more variety then this, and it didn't lose any in contrast to TF:Classic. DoD for HL1 has a lot more diversity for weapon selection, sadly in this version the Axis have very 'unforgiving' weapons that may do slightly more damage, but are horrible to control, while Allies weapons may generally do less damage but are all way more forgiving for recoil; Basically, the original gave both those 'forgiving', 'unforgiving' weapons to both teams except in a couple classes.They also completely removed the british. The US didn't fight the entire war. Any 3 year old knows that.

content:
Posted: February 13
												A classic WW2 FPS for the ages. I love the original Day of Defeat, and this Source Engine overhaul is no exception compared to the original. Sure the British Army was completely removed, and certain classes and weapons were also removed, and even the fact that it was made over a decade ago, but it's still fun as hell to this day and has an amazing player base, with the community still adding on to it with things such as Gungame and working parachutes. I really hope we get a sequel at some point soon with the currently still in-development Source 2 Engine, but the possibility of this happening is slim.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												Day of Defeat Source is a World War 2 multiplayer shooter by valve and is in the style of counter strike but will you want to play CS or this ? Day of Defeat is essiantly counter strike but set in the world war. You can choose two factions the US or the Germans and you fight it out to win. So how is this game ? This game is actually pretty fun but is no where near as fun as counter strike in my eyes but its still a very good game. Theres not much i can say cause this game is just like counter strike bu there are some diffrences. The maps are way bigger and the guns take some time getting used to. But there are a few negatives i want to talk about. Its quite difficult to find people who play on the official valve servers and not some neon filled maps (even though i kinda like those) but the biggest gripe with this game is the community. If you get on a map thats quite populated you will get kicked off for pretty much anything negative you do. Talking on the mic or playing badly will get you kicked off the server quickly. Overall Day of Defeat Source is  a really good game and without a doubt if you like MP shooters get this game right now. I give Day of Defeat Source an 8/10

												It may not compare to other realistic WW2 shooters, but if you thought those were a bit too slow paced and too tactical, this is definitely for you. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2011
												The only "Day" of "Defeat" here is the day you play this sorry excuse for a game. Overall, it has all the elements you might think are needed to make a fun experience: the graphics are nice, the sound is appropriately chaotic, the maps are well-designed, and the Germans sound very angry. However, this is missing the #1 thing any good World War II game needs: constant, blatant ripoffs of Saving Private Ryan and Band of Brothers.Somehow the developers appear to have forgotten that these two things exist, or they couldn't figure out how to hook their DVD player up to their computer in order to record lines straight out of the DVDs, but for whatever reason, this game tries to forge its own vision of World War II rather than coying Spielberg. It's tough to recover from a goof like that. Skip this game and play Call of Duty or Brothers in Arms.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												'' Day of Defeat: Source features multiplayer, team-based gameplay set in the WWII European theatre of operations. Players choose a role and tackle goal-oriented missions based on historical operations. Day of Defeat: Source takes the classic gameplay of the original Day of Defeat and improves the experience with Source, the advanced engine technology Valve created for "Half-Life 2." With this technology, DoD: Source offers state of the art graphics (including support for HDR lighting) in optimized versions of popular maps, plus redesigned sound and all new player, weapon, and world models. New features include: Completely updated maps to take full advantage of the Source engine replaces, integrated physics simulation for ragdolls and physically simulated objects, higher resolution textures throughout, bump mapping, specular lighting, and other graphic effects, all powered by advanced Source engine technology, completely redesigned user interface, all new voice, weapon, and ambient sounds.'' :3

content:
Posted: March 27
												Hello Fellow Soldiers,Welcome to World War II! This game is loads of fun! If you enjoyed Counter-Strike, you'll love this game that is practically that, although without an economy and is set in the war zones of World War II. This game is a great improvement on the original Day of Defeat in several ways and I strongly recommend purchasing this one over the older version. Great game, great communities, great classes in the World War II setting, incredible objectives, it's just a load of fun! I strongly recommend it! Come join the military!-Kyle James

Posted: September 12, 2014
												Congratulations! You've found a game where you can shoot other people in a WWII setting. Considering the war ended almost 60 years ago, there are relatively few places where you can shoot Nazis or shoot people AS nazis anymore. This is one of those places.And every game feels fair-ish.  That is, the winner seems to go back and forth between my team and the other team regardles of whether the team I'm on has to deal with my ineptitude.Plus, this game is like, what, $10 these days? If you're looking for a WWII shooter, this is one that works as a WWII shooter that is well worth $10.Of course, Wolfenstien: Enemy Territory is just as good and costs $0, so maybe you should get that instead.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												Valve takes quite a bit of consideration into this game. It's at its time, it's realistic (fatigue for example, because of the weight of what you carry), and it's very fun. Also, most of the game requires teamwork. Capturing areas needs more than one guy to progress. Sometimes you need to distract a sniper, so have a buddy smoke, or attract with fire. Go prone for cover, etcetera. Overall, this is a great game from Valve..."Not big surprise."

												You know... this game... I have some great memories from the original DoD, and the Source updated version kept a lot of the good things about the original. The game just feels old and clunky at this point though. That, and the fact that there aren't many people to play with / against (and those who do play are usually really, really good), can lead to it really not being fun. I'm going to have to say pass on this one, unless the release a new version, which I doubt they will do.

content:
Posted: March 21
												great engine design yet poorly excuted level design. I don't know who directed the level design / concept, but most official maps are simply a linear maze. You either go to A or B path. While few original maps are not bad, most maps force players to go through narrow path where hell breaks loose. Not much of open field nor free room to flank or maneuver. Everything is too dense and narrow. Feels like Counter Strike Mod. Custom maps are mostly better than the official ones. Has great potential, but rather than making more modes, they should have tried to redesign map to revive the title.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2011
												A fantastic WW2 class based FPS game. You pick a class and go after control points or destroy/defend key landmarks. The weapons tend to be innaccurate but unlike most FPS games only a few bullets will kill you regardless of whether your hit in the head or foot. You have to be constantly aware, people running in and shooting blindly will get taken down quickly. The graphics are a bit dated but they still look decent enough. Overall it's a fun WW2 FPS that requires a decent amount of skill and could use an update similar to Counter-Strike Global Offensive. But as it is right now It's still a pretty good purchase.

												I will always rememeber DOD:S as the first game that I ever bought on Steam After realizing I used to play this game for 400+ hours years ago...it was fun - it was indeed. might be worth picking up when its on sale. I wouldn't expect much from this one after around the 100th hour of gameplay give or take, although there are plenty of custom maps for you to try.Although this was a gem at the time of release there are better options out right now in terms of content and overall depth. as a first choice it was decent for the time period. I only wish there was a sequel made, but then again we know how that goes with Valve.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Probably not as amazing as the Counter-Strike or Portal games, but still well worth playing. The game still has a fairly active community as there are always players on and as you would expect, community servers are always filled with friendly people (in my experience*) the weapons are all just as awkward and difficult to use as they should be. Horrible kick and recoil on most guns, the snipers are both heavy and sway a lot, even the pistols are fairly useless. But that is what makes this a great game, it re-enacts WWII almost perfectly and plays like an old fashioned basic version of TF2. There may even be a third one on the way.... ;)*I am a nice person and therefore get treated with kindness. If you are a♥♥♥♥♥♥ they won't be friendly people.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												Day of Defeat SourceThis game is utterly amazing!, But not enough people play it! I really urge you to stop what your doing and buy it right now! here are some reasons!The game is in a really intresting setting! having a valve multiplayer shooter in world war 2 is really cool! as it just have this really realistic tone you can't find in some of the other games, at all times I really felt as if we were fighting a team and I was just a pawn on a larger board, and that really leads me into my next point there is no other game that really has the same level of team work so here's an example if you all go different ways as random classes you will lose the other team will shatter though your defenses, however if one person on your team goes on mic and organises it you can have snipers on a roof covering one point of contest and then you could have gunners ready to jump in one the machine gunner is in postion, one example is I was playing on the snowy map Colmar and we had hit a stalemate every advance my team made was rebuked by the Germans we kept going, and they attacked vice versa it was stuck around the middle point this happened for about 45mins of intense gameplay if anything went wrong there attack would succeed then suddenly we went is at team and flooded there defences we all died save two of us and those two single handly planted the bomb and won the game.And from another perspective it really shows this game is old so the people still playing are dedicted fans so every match is full of pros but kind pros not the sort who kick you if your new (cough,cough counterstrike I am looking at you cough cough) Its a great community fan made maps are amazing especially strand! which is fighting up a beach,the classes in this game are very well made each to suite a different playstile there is the in your face assualt gunner who is always on the front line or the slightly more reserved sniper or even the heavy weapons Machine Gunner vital for holding an area!Also the atmosphere is amazing each of the maps feels like are in a war and your survival is key to success each map whether its the bombarding of shells and explosians or the brilliantly designed maps unlike any game every round feels intense and atmosperhic, But this game is great cause its not WORLD WAR 2 counterstrike, counter strike is fast and requires quick descions and reactions, this game is very slow in a good way meaning a match could be broken into phases or attack, defense and much more.This game has also aged well with slighly better Graphics than CSSOURCE and for me at least on my laptop I can see frame rates 80-100+ which makes it so smooth! and I am sure those with gaming pc there will see 300+ I could go on for ever Its an amazing game honestly so good!!and if we can get support maybe we may get A "Day of Defeat GO"the mechanics are there with a update into Source 2 I can see this being one of the biggest multiplayer shooters If your reading this Valve you know what to do! Go Buy this game everyone!

content:
Posted: December 7, 2011
												A fantastic WW2 class based FPS game. You pick a class and go after control points or destroy/defend key landmarks. The weapons tend to be innaccurate but unlike most FPS games only a few bullets will kill you regardless of whether your hit in the head or foot. You have to be constantly aware, people running in and shooting blindly will get taken down quickly. The graphics are a bit dated but they still look decent enough. Overall it's a fun WW2 FPS that requires a decent amount of skill and could use an update similar to Counter-Strike Global Offensive. But as it is right now It's still a pretty good purchase.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												This game is one of the best WW2 games for PC. Let me tell you why.Unlike many other games, Day Of Defeat's community is, from what I experienced, pretty mature. Overall, most of the community is good.The graphics are good. They represent well the WW2 era. I really feel like I'm in the end of the 30's and beggining of the 40's while playing this game. The controls are well done. There's not much to say. They're good, period.In gameplay, this is a simple thing. It's a flag capture gameplay. You and your teammates must capture all the flags of the map before the other team. But it is well done too. You have many class choices. Each class has its own primary weapon. The way the guns are used feels realistic too. Oh, and the level design is very good as well.Day Of Defeat Source is yet another very good FPS made by the one and only Valve. A very good one too, just as usual. The only downside I can think of is that the community isn't as active as Counter-Strike or Team Fortress. But still, there is usually always a couple of servers that are open with players on it. So that's Day Of Defeat Source for ya. An excellent FPS. Definitely worth buying. If you enjoy Counter-Strike Global Offensive and Team Fortress 2, you will love Day of Defeat Source.  :)

												if you're a fan of the Source games then yes i would recommend this game, however i do notice some cons,The Rifleman Class:    From my experience i've notice that i can get oneshot easily by this class by other players who quickly scope in, but when i try it i noticed how slow it takes to bring up the iron sights.     i understand "well i guess i got shot in the head" but it doesnt seem logical how quickly the enemy can use the iron sights but i cant,      i would say that this game is bad, but Red Orchestra 2 is abit more Accurate, Fun, and is just plain better,   if you have a barely good PC that can barely run TF2 and most Gmod servers,   then you're pretty much stuck playing this game.

2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 12
												Of all the Valve games I have played, this is the only one that I keep going back to.    Well balanced weapons, instead of a sniper only game (CS with AWP).  Like to run and gun?  play Assault class... cowardly sniper?  or camping Squad machine gun? Standard rifleman.  There is a gun for all styles of play.  Not one of them is over powered compared to the rest.  After years of playing, there are still full servers and plenty of people playing.  Unlike many games, this game tends to attract a more mature player base.  I almost never hear some 12 yr old screaming 'NOOB" or any other such nonsense.  The community is friendly.I really wish that Valve would update this game, but they don't seem interested in it at all.  Its too bad, because I consider this to be Valves best game.   For its price, I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2014
												I have been playing this game for many years and 1000+ hours, though this account only has a few logged. I also occasionally have a server up called the Blunt Club. I was never fond of the official-looking maps but orange maps and sniper maps were my stomping ground for a good 2 year period. The WAR clan hated me because I would head-shot Cobra and all of his army wannabes and the AOD admins loved having someone providing a challenge in both clans' sniper servers. Anyways, with this history in mind I must say that this game is incredibly fun. Like most games, there are things about it that irk me such as the wonky running system, but I'm more of a face value overall kind of reviewer. In that vein, I give this game:         _->      8/10     <-_

Posted: April 12, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.i like the mg  tbh

content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												Unrealistic and impractical! From the ridiculous shell shock to the game always granting 99 damage strikes on opposition it is an utter failure. The game is also loaded with unethical server administrators on public servers whom permit cheating and are engaging in it themselves (mass-scale).  Many bind the hack to a key and toggle it when needed while masquerading as something they aren't. The developer practically encourages it by allowing loop holes and exploits in the code.  They shove this vac system out there to give noobs the illusion of protection while they cheat on the game then have the nerve to call it skill.. Talk about self esteem issues, get a life already.  I guarantee if you shove all players in one room, on one secure LAN where each system has been thoroughly inspected by someone knowledgable on the subject and also closely monitor each player during play (non-affiliated with either gamer) the outcome would be a million times different. Anyone who brags about success on a multiplayer first-person shooter game like this in a public server is a moron.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												I played the original mod for Half-Life and it was great.  It was a nice change of pace when you sick of playing Team Fortress Classic.  The sequel didn't really capture the magic of the original.  Day of Defeat: Source is a World War II first person shooting game.  It's pretty good but I never really got into it.  It doesn't help that Valve basically abandoned the game very early on.  The only thing keeping this game going are 14 year old boys who like to pretend to be Nazis for a little while.Pwninator score: 7/10

Though the best part of it is the WWII fictional pretend power hungry units where  little kids think they run the world because they have "earned" a fictional rank in the "military unit", with administrative powers that give them the abilities to rage and magically make everyone disappear from the server for  span of a couple of minutes to permanent. Females will be sadly be thrown into the front lines of various horny, sexually frustrated virgins and suffocate under the constant begging for nudes. content:
Posted: June 16, 2012
												Starting as a simple Half-Life mod, Day of Defeat quickly became the world's #1 online shooter. It's immense popularity gave it a retail release with Day of Defeat: Source. While there is still a very active fanbase, it has aged a bit, and might be worth the wait for Day of Defeat: Global Offensive, which will further refine and expand this modern classic.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 12, 2014
												=Old Review=RIP Day of Defeat Source.  Now, this isn't a complete "don't buy this," but it's definitely not the kind of thing I'd recommend to just anyone below.  Just read, it'll make sense.I regret to inform you that this game has a very low server population.  Usually, it's down to 5 servers, none of which are full.  The most played map is an Orange map, with excessive MG and ladder camping.  Sound fun?  Didn't think so.There is an exception, of course.  You can find a Steam group that holds events for old games such as DoD:S.  Play with them.  So maybe you can't just pick it up whenever you want, but it's still worth the money if you can get into matches.TL;DR: the game itself is solid and it's a lot of fun as a WWII shooter.  It also has massive improvements over DoD, which are easily visible.  In some cases, DoD classic won't be an option, since it has quite a few compatibility issues (at least for me, it does).  However, you'll need to find a Steam group or play with friends, or you won't ever get to have fun with this game.Final verdict: 8/10, but doesn't have players.=UPDATE=So yes, I originally said "don't get the game" simply because it didn't have players.  While I still say you shouldn't get it unless you're willing to do a bit of setup and scheduling for matches, the servers you DO get on randomly can be a lot of fun.  On this premise and the experience I've had with the last few matches I've played (not on that orange map, thank God) have been great.Overall, maybe an 8.5/10.  Not for everyone.  You might occasionally have no server to play.

												This is one of the epicest WWII shooters I've played. It may be old yes but you will still find plenty of servers. You know you're on the right server when:1. Everyone says GG when U.S or Wehrmacht win or when map rotates (most servers have it)2. You have fun 3. You have epic quickscopes every time you're sniperDon't charge in into the thick of it solo, you're handing your character a death sentence (you respawn duh its a Valve game). Work as a team and advance, capturing the flags or blowing up stuff depending on map. Trust me, you like FPS, you will love this.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												I played this game for months, if not years, when it got out. It was really really fun back in 2006. If I were to write a review then, I would have given it a 10+. But since then many games have evolved, but, unfortunatelly, Valve didn't offer any attention to this wonderful game, so, now, the community has shrinked and there's not much fun as it was in the past. Many people playing DoD:S have moved to TF2 and CS:GO, or other FPSs. A multiplayer game is fun when the community is strong. If you want to invest into a WW game, I would advise you to buy Verdun. It's in its early stages of development, but at least the community will only grow from this point forward.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												Honestly, I'm dissapointed with this game.  I expected a better, more realistic, WWII FPS.  Instead a got some (What felt like)  Call of Duty clone.  There is no suppressing fire system, meaning, if i set up an MG emplacement, and begins firing at a sniper, if i don't hit and kill him, he can quickly react and shoot me.  That makes playing MG almost impossible.  Also, playing sniper is very difficult as well.  If you even think about standing still while sniper, be prepared to get shot.  I may be expierencing a learning curve of some sort, but I didn't enjoy this game.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Although Valve has irreversibly ruined what was once a great game with novel ideas since buying Day of Defeat from the original developers, the game still maintains some level of entertainment. I have no idea how much it costs because I've always owned this game - maybe 10 dollars now? - but it's still worth it. Unfortunately, there aren't any other WW2 first person shooters anymore. I highly doubt anyone plays CoD WaW anymore and Heroes and Generals is...meh. Unless people are still playing Enemy Front.I don't know about everyone else, but basically my entire time spent playing DoD source is  similar to the life of a heroin addict. I spend all my time when I play trying to relive the glorious moments possible in the original DoD, when you could set up an MG and literally slaughter SO MANY people on the other team before you got killed - if you got killed. Unfortunately, source engine has eliminated that ability because of lighting and because of how overly accurate all guns are, but that is my quest.To go into further detail:DoD, before Valve bought it, had paratrooper maps. Paratrooper maps were CS like 1-spawn only objective-based rounds, with paratroopers - obviously. So you had excellent maps like hedgerow, and you got FG42s, and the greasegun, as well as the K43 and M1 Carbine. Valve got rid of all of that. They got rid of the British team entirely, and with them the Enfield, Bren, Sten, Webley, and their grenades. In addition, they also got rid of the Bar bipod, and the MG34. This variety is what made the game so awesome from 2000 until it was bought. One of the most absurdly ridiculous things in the game is that Valve put in RPGs, and they were there for a now non-existent purpose, yet the class and weapons remain in the game. The RPG class is just ridiculous - Allies get M1 Carbine with only 3 mags, Axis gets an automatic C96 with a stock. Both of them very good  guns in the game, especially C96. Then they can drop their RPGs and get a primary. Those classes were originally put in the game for objectve maps where you actually had to destroy building parts or other objectives with them . The modern game literally has none of those maps, yet, you can still use the class. And it's completely ridiculous - I say this as someone who likes playing that class - because you can literally run around and rocket people in the face. Snipe people with rockets.Even if you get the original DoD on Steam, you're not going to find that experience. Maybe you can find some private servers of beta DoD, if you are willing to try to look at 17 year old graphics. Nonetheless, the game is irreparably broken, and Valve hasn't done a mother ♥♥♥♥ing thing to it in literally 10 years. Over10 years. They have literally never made an actual content update. The ONE thing they ever updated was the patch that introduced film grain to spectator mode and made a few other spectator adjustments. Every single gun is royally broken, overpowered, overaccurate, over-recoiled, and the hitboxes are supremely broken. The netcode, as well, is ungodly bad. It's embarrassing that this blemish exists while other Source games are so solid like Left 4 Dead or Insurgency.If you want a WW2 game that isn't complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, I suggest playing Red Orchestra 2.

number of helpful: 0 of 7 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												If you look at the release date for this game July 12, 2010, you'll know it's not true. Released on Sept 26, 2005 this was a great alternative to CS:S. Which I played for many years before DOD:S. This game had something different to offer than other fps games at the time. You picked classes and also allowed you to respawn, which offered continuous gameplay.In it's hay day this game was a blast, especially for competitive league players. However this game has lost it's magic and has died. I have played this game for many many years and have 2 accounts with a combined total of 2,763 hours, I have played in many different competitive leagues, on different teams and also had my own team at one point.Out of all the fps games I've ever played (since Wolfenstein 3D, 1992) this game I have always felt discriminated against for being legitimately good. Over 75 public server perma bans, hence the 2nd account.I am not trying to gloat or brag, this is a big issue for almost every league player. Unit and clan public server admins would pretty much just ban me without notice or call me hacker/cheater than perma ban me. I would even use my 2nd account with another name and had to actually hold myself back due to threat of being banned... I just always felt this saltyness from certain servers.I have in the past uninstalled this game, due to lack of server, player and league quality.If you want to purchase an FPS game look elsewhere, this game is outdated and it's hard to find a good server to play on without mods.Plus the assault is overused and probably one the worst F$%KING weapons made by an actual human being and agreed upon to be released in a game.

number of helpful: 1 of 10 people (10%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												As a game published by Valve who also published Counter Strike and Team Fortress, a WW2 shooter multiplayer shooter would seem to be quite good with good reasons to buy it, after all its Valve so it must be good right? Wrong.This game seems to lacking in technically everything that Counter Strike was great for, with it having limits to its classes, boring maps, boring gameplay, simply this game misses the hit on all good stuff.The worst part of this is that is doesn't feel like it should be a multiplayer only game and that it should be a Single Player game, there is so much in this game which somehow makes it feel like it was developed to be a Single Player game but was instead made as a Online Only game.Overall opinion is to NOT buy this game - Pros:Nice IdeasLooks Great because of its Source Engine redoCons:Limited GameplayFeels Rushed for a Valve gameShould've became a Single Player game instead.Score - 4/10

number of helpful: 1 of 10 people (10%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												A dull WWII Source engine FPS. The guns fee clunky and cumbersome, and just as in all Source games, they lack iron sights. Melee combat is strange and hard to transition to, since you can't simply snap the butt of your rifle into the enemy, and are instead required to switch to the melee inventory slot, often a trench shovel, which costs you precious seconds. The maps are bland, poorly decorated, and cramped, and the graphics are straight out of 2004. If you're looking for a good WWII shooter, stick with CoD, you'll still have more fun.
